reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Volume I've been waiting for
reviews.reviewText: SPOILERS AHEADThis volume feels like the reward that the last 4 volumes have been building up to. Yume and Ranta are back in action with the team with their new skills, the Tokkis returning with their usual antics, and Renji's team with much more characterization this time around. Everything came together and I couldn't put the book down. The action, the banter, and the team dynamics felt so nostalgic but also fresh.It's hard to believe that it's been at least 3-4 years for Haru and his team since starting in Alterna, and their growth has immensely shown. I can't wait to see the resolve continue into the next volume. Hopefully it won't be a long wait!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: It's fire, all the adventures and characters, fire. Maybe not Ranta completely, but he has his moments. This is peak Isekai.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Don't forget to read the epilogue. Love the character progression it continues. It's good to see their relationships still exist without their memories

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Withiout remebering his previous difficult battles we once again have a pick at haruhiro's true natur. A regular, every day dude like any other that knows only to fight for his and his teams survival. Love it. Also loved the ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really enjoyed the action, and great surprise at the end
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoying this series! Happy to see some old familiar faces return, and the surprise at the end was nice, but still suspenseful. I really hope it all doesn't end with them getting their memories back and it's over. Would love to see them tackle a dungeon with all their memories and working in sync again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Hated the End
reviews.reviewText: I'd say this is a spoiler but no one will be shocked to hear this that has made it to this point... Haru is back to totally incompetent and can not make a single good decision by himself which is so frustrating. We'll have to see if I get the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2021
reviews.reviewText: De lo mejor que he leído!!!!Pensar que la historia se desarrolle tan fluidamente y ese final con Ranta Hahaha

Los enanos son una de mis razas favoritas y la vrd me dolió ver lo que les paso T_T pero me gusto al mismo tiempo, ese golpe al optimismo y esperanza que nos dio al final ufff me deja con la intriga de lo que sucederá!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 8, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This Volume felt almost like the opposite of the previous one which I must admit, I barely recall due to the lack of meaningfulness. Whereas the previous Volume had an abundance of calm walking and reflective sections but little fights, this one had long protracted fights and short reflective ones, which I cannot say left me any more satisfied.The adventure through the castle was almost tediously long. While I have always enjoyed the slow pace of this series, I must say the balance between meaningful fights and social interactions has somewhat been lost on me. It felt like a long run. The long journey was occasionally filled with small breaks which more often than not were filled with the characters' idiosyncrasies which, after 16 volumes, have finally started to grate on me. Yume's mix ups of common phrases followed by another character's pointless attempt at correcting her, Inui's stubborn obsession with a female character... While it is not wrong to include these in each volumes to remind us of the way a character is but the frequency of it is a bit too much. Repeating the same thing in short succession feels too forced and unnatural. Having said that, there were touching moments that remind us that growth and moving forward can mean leaving something (or someone) behind.The best part of the book to me were the short stories at the end which I found to be the best written parts of the book. Little to no unnecessary comedic relief but true insight into the characters and real demonstration of growth especially on Ranta's part. We also got to delve a bit more into Renji which I hope we get more of in the coming volumes. The fear of the end keeps growing within me but with the re-apparition of Shihoru, I feel there is yet more to discover...

This one was better than the last one. But the whole memory wiping thing is getting annoying. It feels like nothing anyone does is worth anything, because their memory just gets wiped and therefore no reward or pay off for anything. The last 4 books were basically worthless because of this.
La historia ss desarrolla muy bien y el realismo y intriga te atrapan
